text: Convergence of fixed point iteration Assuming p < 1 as for the fixed point theorem, yields |zri1 — 2*| = [g(zk) — g(2")| < plzi — 27. This is a contraction by factor p. So |Trr1 — 2| < plak — 2¥| < pHary — 2| < ... < 2o — 2¥| = 0. The smaller p the faster convergence is. We are interested in the neighborhood of z* (locality!): take p=lg'(z")l.
